definitions.definition: Producing abrasion ; rough enough to wear away the outer surface.
Being rough and coarse in manner or disposition; overly aggressive and causing irritation.
examples: An abrasive person can grate on one's sensibilities.
Despite her proper upbringing, we found her manners to be terribly abrasive .

main_definition: Producing abrasion ; rough enough to wear away the outer surface. [First attested in 1805.]
secondary_definitions: Being rough and coarse in manner or disposition; overly aggressive and causing irritation. [First attested in 1925.]
